title.narrative: NGO Aid Map: Strengthening NGO Capacity for Data Sharing

description.narrative:
NGO Aid Map has continued to grow and thrive since it launched in 2010. To date, we have collected data on over 14,000 projects from 136 organizations in 182 countries. This represents close to $15 billion in programs. Our long-term vision is to transform the platform into one that visualizes what all NGOs are doing around the world. Although we know this will take time, we believe we have built a strong foundation for getting there. In order to succeed, we need to gather more NGO data and to ensure that this data is valuable to multiple audiences. To achieve this, we will continue to focus on making it easier for members to provide data, while also implementing strategies that will make it worthwhile to share data through added incentives. The goal and objectives for this next phase of work are as follows:
Goal: To improve the effectiveness of aid efforts by making comprehensive, high quality information on NGO aid activities public in a timely and accessible manner.
Objectives: 1. Increase the number of organizations participating in NGO Aid Map 2. Improve the quality of the data on NGO Aid Map 3. Increase the value of NGO aid data to key users, e.g. NGOs, the media, and private sector
